wikipedia_page.main: The Great Landowners of Great Britain and Ireland (originally The Acre-Ocracy of England) is a reference work published by John Bateman in four editions between 1876 and 1883, giving brief details of individuals owning land in the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland to a total of 3,000 acres (1,200 ha) or valuation of £3000 annual income. It has become a standard primary source for historians of the Victorian era.

response: * John Bateman, 2nd Viscount Bateman (1721–1802), British politician
* John Bateman (Australian settler) (1789–1855), one of the first Europeans in Fremantle
* John Bateman (editor) (1839–1910), English compiler of The Great Landowners of Great Britain and Ireland
* John Bateman (baseball) (1940–1996), Major League Baseball catcher
* John Bateman (rugby league) (born 1993), professional rugby league player
* Lucas North, formerly known as John Bateman, a fictional character from the BBC television series Spooks
